name: Avenida Paulista
address: Av. Paulista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
description: São Paulo’s iconic cultural and financial avenue, lined with museums, shopping centers, restaurants, and cultural attractions. A lively pedestrian zone on Sundays.

name: Parque Ibirapuera
address: Av. Pedro Álvares Cabral, Vila Mariana, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
description: A 158-hectare urban park featuring lakes, museums, gardens, and jogging paths. One of the most visited parks in South America.

name: Mercado Municipal de São Paulo
address: R. da Cantareira, 306, Centro Histórico, São Paulo - SP, 01024-900, Brazil
description: Historic market opened in 1933, famous for its stained-glass windows and gourmet offerings including the iconic mortadella sandwich.

name: Pinacoteca do Estado
address: Praça da Luz, Luz, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
description: Founded in 1905, this is Brazil’s oldest art museum, showcasing Brazilian art from the 19th century to contemporary works.

name: MASP – Museu de Arte de São Paulo
address: Av. Paulista, 1578, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
description: One of Latin America’s most important art museums, housed in an iconic building designed by Lina Bo Bardi, with a collection spanning European and Brazilian masters.

name: Catedral da Sé
address: Praça da Sé, Sé, São Paulo - SP, 01001-000, Brazil
description: A grand Neo-Gothic cathedral with towering spires and one of the largest pipe organs in South America, seating up to 8,000 people.

name: Estádio do Pacaembu / Museu do Futebol
address: Praça Charles Miller, s/n, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
description: Historic stadium housing the Football Museum, featuring interactive exhibits about the history and culture of Brazilian soccer.

name: Liberdade (Bairro Japonês)
address: Liberdade, Sé, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
description: São Paulo’s Japantown, known for its lantern-lined streets, Japanese restaurants, markets, and vibrant cultural festivals.
